oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Biological productivity enhancement over a continental shelf break (Bay of Biscay, NE Atlantic) evidenced by mesozooplankton aspartate transcarbamylase activity
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bergeron, Jean-pierre
Koueta, Noussithe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Aspartate transcarbamylase
Chlorophyll a
Mesozooplankton
Satellite imagery
Continental shelf break
Bay of Biscay
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During spring of 2005, satellite imagery revealed high sea surface chlorophyll a concentrations over the edge of a wide continental shelf in the Bay of Biscay (NE Atlantic). As a descriptor of biological productivity, mesozooplankton aspartate transcarbamylase specific activity was measured in situ during the bloom. Notably high values were detected in the bloom area relative to other parts of the study area.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Journal Of Oceanography (0916-8370) (Springer), 2011-04 , Vol. 67 , N. 2 , P. 249-252
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: The Oceanographic Society of Japan and Springer 2011
